main.name: Nicholas Prussen
main.description: Computer Science major in my Junior year at Boise State University
main.bio: Computer Science major in my junior year at Boise State University. I'm very passionate about programming and I absolutely love jumping into the deep end on new projects and new languages. Lately I've been doing web development and learning the ropes of React and Flask to serve benchmark data in generated graphs for the Parflow Project.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: Data Structures, Linear Algebra, Databases, Systems Programming, Programming Languages, Discrete Mathematics

work.title: Student Researcher
work.description: Working alonside professors and students to create data flow optimizations with programming languages and transformations. Currently doing Web Development for the Parflow team to integrate benchmark results stored in MongoDB to be displayed on a dynamic website using React and Flask. Previously worked on the Adapt Lidar Tools project.

work.title: Warehouse Worker
work.description: Processed international shipments headed to warehouses for multinational retail stores. Also unloaded and organized shipping containers.

work.title: Cashier/Cook
work.description: Worked as both a Cashier and Cook and took on responsibilities of a Shift Lead without a promotion due to me being under the age of 18.

projects.title: Adapt Lidar Tools
projects.category: An array of tools for processing full-waveform lidar data.

projects.title: Parflow Performance Testing
projects.category: A set of benchmarks for the Parflow project.

projects.title: Wumpus World App
projects.category: My CS121 project, which I rebuilt using Android Studio into an Android App published on the Play Store.

projects.title: Parflow Performance Benchmarks Website
projects.category: Currently being built using React, Flask and MongoDB. Still in development but will be public when finished.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
